thread.title: Top travel photos of the week
thread.title_full: Top travel photos of the week

title: Top travel photos of the week
persons: David Ramos Alan Crowhurst David Ramos/Getty Pablo Blazquez Dominguez Chris
text:
Top travel photos of the week Last updated 09:19, July 24 2015 REUTERS/Kacper Pempel KACPER PEMPEL/Reuters KACPER PEMPEL/Reuters JUAN MEDINA/REUTERS JUAN MEDINA/REUTERS ILYA NAYMUSHIN/REUTERS ILYA NAYMUSHIN/Reuters VASILY FEDOSENKO/Reuters VASILY FEDOSENKO/Reuters SCANPIX DENMARK/Reuters SCANPIX DENMARK/Reuters Chung Sung-Jun/Getty Images KIM HONG-JI/Reuters Reuters Chung Sung-Jun/Getty Images Chung Sung-Jun/Getty Images DENIS BALIBOUSE/Reuters REUTERS/Jon Nazca JON NAZCA/Reuters ANINDITO MUKHERJEE/Reuters Mario Tama/Getty Images Mario Tama/Getty Images MIKE SEGAR/Reuters David Ramos/Getty Images David Ramos David Ramos/Getty Images David Ramos/Getty Images JON NAZCA/Reuters JON NAZCA/Reuters THOMAS PETER/Reuters BERNADETT SZABO/Reuters Thomas Lohnes/Getty Images Clive Brunskill/Getty Images Pablo Blazquez Dominguez Jan Hetfleisch/Getty Images HEINO KALIS/Reuters Reuters HEINO KALIS/Reuters Carl Court/Getty Images Jeff J Mitchell/Getty Images David Ramos Alan Crowhurst David Ramos/Getty Pablo Blazquez Dominguez Chris Jackson/Getty Images 
A participant of the Castle Party festival displays her costume at castle in Bolkow, southwestern Poland. 
The annual festival features around 50 musicians and artists playing on various stage Gothic rock and other styles of the dark music subculture. 
Outside Germany, it is one of the biggest festival with this genre of music, the event attracts regular international audience of up to 5000, the organisers said. 
Revellers take part in the annual "Naval Battle" of Vallecas in Madrid, Spain. 
The slogan for this year's water battle is "Get wet for Alfon, freedom for Alfon", referring to Alfonso Fernandez Ortega, a Vallecas resident who was sentenced to four years in prison in June. The festival was started spontaneously in 1981 when some neighbours started to throw water at one another due to high temperatures during the Virgen del Carmen Festival. 
People covered with mineral-rich black mud rest on the bank of Tus lake in Khakassia region, southwest of the Siberian city of Krasnoyarsk, Russia. 
During the summer, Russians from different regions travel to lake Tus, famed for the curative properties of its black and blue sediments, to bathe in the salty water and smear themselves with mud. 
People look at hot air balloons at the Cup Hot Air event during the Air Sports festival titled "70 Years of Peaceful Sky" in Minsk, Belarus. 
Hot air balloons are seen in Minsk, Belarus.Fedosenko 
Participants of the World Congress of Santa Clauses 2015 take part in the annual swim at Bellevue beach, north of Copenhagen, Denmark. 
A participants of the World Congress of Santa Clauses in Copenhagen, Denmark 
Festival-goers wrestle in the mud during the annual Boryeong Mud Festival at Daecheon Beach in Boryeong, South Korea. 
The mud, which is believed to have benefical effects on the skin due to its mineral content, is sourced from mud flats near Boryeong and transported to the beach by truck. 
A tourists takes a selfie as he attends the Boryeong Mud Festival. 
About 2 to 3 million domestic and international tourists visit the beach during the annual mud festival, according to the festival organisers. 
It definitely looks like it's fun. 
Revellers take a selfie during the Paleo Festival in Nyon, Switzerland 
People hold onto windows to avoid a bull during the 'Toro de Cuerda' (Bull on Rope) festival in Grazalema, southern Spain. 
Three bulls restrained by a rope are allowed to run through the streets of the village during the annual festival. REUTERS/Jon Nazca TPX IMAGES OF THE DAY 
Muslims pray at the Jama Masjid (Grand Mosque) on the occasion of Eid al-Fitr in the old quarters of Delhi, India. The Eid al-Fitr festival marks the end of the holy month of Ramadan. 
People gather on a roof deck next to a partially completed building in the Vidigal favela community which overlooks Ipanema beach in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. 
People stand and take photos from a partially completed building in the Vidigal favela community 
A man circles a tourist in a giant soap bubble at Columbus Circle near Central Park in New York on a warm summer day. 
An aerial view of Levante Beach in Benidorm, Spain. 
People sunbathe at Poniente Beach in Benidorm, Spain. Spain has set a new record for visitors, with 29.2 million visitors in June. 
Spain is also expected to be the main destination of tourists seeking a value-for-money all-inclusive holiday after the Tunisia attack. 
A general view of apartment towers in Benidorm, Spain. 
A local guide applauds at the center of an arena next to Asian tourists, to let them hear the acoustic of the bullring in Ronda, southern Spain. 
A tourist walks on the arena of a bullring in Ronda, southern Spain. 
Tourists walk past a replica of the Statue of Liberty in the Odaiba district of Tokyo. 
Tourists cool off in water vapor in front of the Hungarian Parliament during a hot summer day in Budapest, Hungary. 
The sculpture 'Man walking to the sky' of the artist Jonathan Borofskyon as a part of the 'documenta IX' (1992) pictured in Kassel, Germany. Founded in 1955, the documenta exhibitions have become one of the most important events in the modern art world. They now take place every five years with the next one, documenta 14, scheduled for 2017. 
Fans celebrate the win between Jamie Murray and Andy Murray of Great Britain against Nicolas Mahut and Jo-Wilfried Tsonga of France during Day Two of the World Group Quarter Final Davis Cup match between Great Britain and France at Queens Club in London, England. 
Terraces for salt production stand in the Salt Valley of Anana near Alava, Spain. The Salt Valley of Anana has natural brine springs which have been used by humans to produce salt since prehistory. Anana produces in a traditional way, by natural evaporation, 'flower of salt' which is becoming well used by some of the best Chefs in Spain. 
A general view of the floating stage (Seebuehne) of Bregenz opera house, during the rehearsal for the opera 'Turandot' prior the Bregenz Festival (Bregenzer Festspiele) in Bregenz, Austria. 
A group of tourists walks over the Plaza de la Virgen (Virgin Square) in downtown Valencia, Spain. 
The Reynolds Creek Wildland Fire burns in Glacier National Park, Montana. Strong winds and warm temperatures were slowing efforts to contain the 4000 acre wildfire, forcing campers to evacuate near the eastern entrance and closing part of an iconic roadway popular with tourists, official said. 
Tourists at the cathedral in downtown Valencia, Spain. 
Ferraris are pictured behind a blue Dubai-registered Pagani Huayra in London, England. London has become known in recent years for a proliferation of foreign cars worth hundreds of thousands of pounds with tourists and car spotters stopping to admire the vehicles. 
An installation by Rachel Hendry at the Phoenix Bursary Exhibition in Glasgow, Scotland. 
A tourist enjoy parasailing at Poniente Beach in Benidorm, Spain. 
A general view as runners make their way around the top bend at Bath racecourse in Bath, England. 
People sunbathe at Levante Beach in Benidorm, Spain. 
People row a boat in El Retiro Park in Madrid, Spain. A third heat wave this summer has seen hot weather alerts issued in 18 provinces across Spain. This July is believed to have been the hottest this century. 
Prince Charles, Prince of Wales meets a giant Starfish and Lobster as he meets 'Surfers Against Sewage' representatives at an Ocean Plastics Awareness Day on Fistral Beach in Newquay, United Kingdom. 1 of 45 
Here is our round up of the top travel photos from around the world. 
Do you have a favourite? Let us know in the comments.
